text: Thanks, yea, relative paths work just fine. I just thought it was cool to be able to ignore the path and use `@` â€”especially as I add and nest more folders

just so we're definitely on the same page, I've been using another project to practice, and this is how they import components/files:
```import { GridPattern } from '@/components/GridPattern'
import { SectionHeading } from '@/components/SectionHeading'
import authorImage from '@/images/avatars/author.png'```

I'm getting this error when I try to upload my React project:
```--- Hello World - React failed to build with the following error ---
[ERROR] The build failed due to an internal error with id `e524012c-66dc-4bbf-8ca5-cd97e12ea647`. Try uploading it again. If the problem persists, contact HubSpot support with the error id.```
